metadata.title: CVE-2017-8779 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
rpcbind through 0.2.4, LIBTIRPC through 1.0.1 and 1.0.2-rc through1.0.2-rc3, and NTIRPC through 1.4.3 do not consider the maximum RPC datasize during memory allocation for XDR strings, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption with nosubsequent free) via a crafted UDP packet to port 111, aka rpcbomb.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8779` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtirpc-common - 0.2.5-1.2
libtirpc3 - 0.2.5-1.2
No subscription required

rpcbind - 1.2.5-9
No subscription required

libntirpc3.4 - 1.6.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libtirpc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.5-1.2').
rpcbind package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.2.5-9').
ntirpc package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.1-1').
